Hugging Face Smell Detector

class ml_code_smell_detector.detectors.huggingface_detector.HuggingFaceSmellDetector[source]

Bases: object

A detector class that identifies common code smells in Hugging Face Transformers code.

This detector analyzes Python code that uses the Hugging Face Transformers library and identifies potential issues and best practices violations related to model training, data processing, and performance optimization.

detect_smells(file_path)[source]

Analyze a Python file for Hugging Face-related code smells.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – Path to the Python file to analyze.

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing detected code smells and their details.

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Any]]

is_framework_used(node, framework)[source]

Check if a specific framework is imported in the module.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • framework (str) – Name of the framework to check for

Returns:

True if the framework is imported, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

visit_module(node, file_path)[source]

Visit a module node and run all smell detection checks.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

add_smell(smell, fix, benefits, strategies, node, file_path)[source]

Add a detected code smell to the results.

Parameters:

  • smell (str) – Description of the code smell

  • fix (str) – How to fix the issue

  • benefits (str) – Benefits of fixing the issue

  • strategies (str) – Specific strategies to implement the fix

  • node (NodeNG) – AST node where the smell was detected

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file containing the smell

check_model_versioning(node, file_path)[source]

Check if model versions are explicitly specified when loading pre-trained models.

Detects cases where models are loaded without version tags, which could lead to reproducibility issues.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_tokenizer_caching(node, file_path)[source]

Check if tokenizer caching is enabled when loading tokenizers.

Detects cases where tokenizers are loaded without caching configuration, which could lead to unnecessary re-downloads and slower loading times.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_model_caching(node, file_path)[source]

Check if model caching is enabled when loading models.

Detects cases where models are loaded without caching configuration, which could lead to unnecessary re-downloads and slower loading times.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_deterministic_tokenization(node, file_path)[source]

Check if tokenization parameters are explicitly specified.

Detects cases where tokenization settings are not explicitly defined, which could lead to inconsistent preprocessing across runs.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_efficient_data_loading(node, file_path)[source]

Check if efficient data loading techniques are being used.

Detects cases where standard data loading is used instead of optimized methods like datasets library or DataLoader.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_distributed_training(node, file_path)[source]

Check if distributed training is configured when using training functionality.

Detects cases where training code is present but distributed training settings are not configured.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_mixed_precision_training(node, file_path)[source]

Check if mixed precision training is enabled.

Detects cases where training is performed without mixed precision settings, which could lead to suboptimal performance and memory usage.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_gradient_accumulation(node, file_path)[source]

Check if gradient accumulation is configured for training.

Detects cases where training is performed without gradient accumulation, which could be beneficial for handling larger effective batch sizes.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_learning_rate_scheduling(node, file_path)[source]

Check if learning rate scheduling is configured.

Detects cases where training is performed without learning rate scheduling, which could lead to suboptimal training dynamics.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

check_early_stopping(node, file_path)[source]

Check if early stopping is implemented in training.

Detects cases where training code is present but early stopping mechanisms are not configured, which could lead to overfitting.

Parameters:

  • node (Module) – AST node representing the module

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file being analyzed

generate_report()[source]

Generate a formatted report of all detected code smells.

Returns:

A string containing the formatted report with all detected smells and their counts.

Return type:

str

get_results()[source]

Get the detected smells in a simplified format.

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing smell details in a simplified format suitable for integration with other tools.

Return type:

List[Dict[str, str]]
